00015 **  Purpose:
00016 **  This file contains the Internal interface for the cFE Application control functions of ES.
00017 **  These functions and data structures manage the Applications and Child tasks in the cFE.
00018 **

00075 #define _cfe_es_apps_

00084 /*
00085 ** Macro Definitions
00086 */
00087 
00088 /*
00089 ** The overall cFE System State
00090 */
00091 #define CFE_ES_SYSTEM_STATE_UNDEFINED       0   
00092 #define CFE_ES_SYSTEM_STATE_EARLY_INIT      1   
00093 #define CFE_ES_SYSTEM_STATE_CORE_STARTUP    2   
00094 #define CFE_ES_SYSTEM_STATE_CORE_READY      3   
00095 #define CFE_ES_SYSTEM_STATE_OPERATIONAL     4   
00096 #define CFE_ES_SYSTEM_STATE_SHUTTING_DOWN   5   
00098 /*
00099 ** The Type of cFE Application
00100 */
00101 #define CFE_ES_APP_TYPE_CORE       1
00102 #define CFE_ES_APP_TYPE_EXTERNAL   2
00103 
00104 /*
00105 ** Application Run-State defines
00106 */
00107 #define CFE_ES_APP_STATE_RUNNING      1
00108 #define CFE_ES_APP_STATE_STOPPED      2
00109 #define CFE_ES_APP_STATE_WAITING      3
00110 #define CFE_ES_APP_STATE_INITIALIZING 4
00111 
00112 /*
00113 ** Application exception action defines
00114 */
00115 #define CFE_ES_APP_EXCEPTION_RESTART_APP  0
00116 #define CFE_ES_APP_EXCEPTION_PROC_RESTART 1
00117 
00118 /*
00119 ** Type Definitions
00120 */
00121 
00122 /*
00123 ** CFE_ES_AppState_t is a structure of information for External cFE Apps.
00124 **   This information is used to control/alter the state of External Apps.
00125 **   The fields in this structure are not needed or used for the cFE Core Apps.
00126 */
00127 typedef struct
00128 {
00129    uint32     AppControlRequest;              /* What the App should be doing next */
00130    uint32     AppState;                       /* Is the app running, or stopped, or waiting? */
00131    int32      AppTimer;                       /* Countdown timer for killing an app */
00132 
00133 } CFE_ES_AppState_t;
00134 
00135 
00136 /*
00137 ** CFE_ES_AppStartParams_t is a structure of information used when an application is
00138 **   created in the system. It is stored in the cFE ES App Table
00139 */
00140 typedef struct
00141 {
00142   uint8                 Name[OS_MAX_API_NAME];
00143   uint8                 EntryPoint[OS_MAX_API_NAME];
00144   uint8                 FileName[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00145 
00146   uint32                StackSize;
00147   uint32                StartAddress;
00148   uint32                ModuleId;
00149 
00150   uint16                ExceptionAction;
00151   uint16                Priority;
00152    
00153 } CFE_ES_AppStartParams_t;
00154 
00155 /*
00156 ** CFE_ES_MainTaskInfo_t is a structure of information about the main
00157 ** task and child tasks in a cFE application. This structure is just used in the
00158 ** cFE_ES_AppRecord_t structure. 
00159 */
00160 typedef struct
00161 {
00162    uint32   MainTaskId;                     /* The Application's Main Task ID */
00163    uint8    MainTaskName[OS_MAX_API_NAME];  /* The Application's Main Task ID */
00164    uint32   NumOfChildTasks;                /* Number of Child tasks for an App */
00165 
00166 } CFE_ES_MainTaskInfo_t;
00167 
00168 
00169 /*
00170 ** CFE_ES_AppRecord_t is an internal structure used to keep track of
00171 ** CFE Applications that are active in the system.
00172 */
00173 typedef struct
00174 {
00175    boolean                 RecordUsed;                  /* Is the record used(1) or available(0) ? */
00176    uint32                  Type;                        /* The type of App: CORE or EXTERNAL */
00177    CFE_ES_AppStartParams_t StartParams;                 /* The start parameters for an App */
00178    CFE_ES_AppState_t       StateRecord;                 /* The State info for External cFE Apps */
00179    CFE_ES_MainTaskInfo_t   TaskInfo;                    /* Information about the Tasks */
00180       
00181 } CFE_ES_AppRecord_t;
00182 
00183 
00184 /*
00185 ** CFE_ES_TaskRecord_t is an internal structure used to keep track of
00186 ** CFE Tasks that are active in the system.
00187 */
00188 typedef struct
00189 {
00190    boolean   RecordUsed;                      /* Is the record used(1) or available(0) */
00191    uint32    AppId;                           /* The parent Application's App ID */
00192    uint32    TaskId;                          /* Task ID */
00193    uint32    ExecutionCounter;                /* The execution counter for the Child task */
00194    char      TaskName[OS_MAX_API_NAME];       /* Task Name */
00195    
00196    
00197 } CFE_ES_TaskRecord_t;
00198 
00199 /*
00200 ** CFE_ES_LibRecord_t is an internal structure used to keep track of
00201 ** CFE Shared Libraries that are loaded in the system.
00202 */
00203 typedef struct
00204 {
00205    boolean   RecordUsed;                      /* Is the record used(1) or available(0) */
00206    char      LibName[OS_MAX_API_NAME];        /* Library Name */
00207 } CFE_ES_LibRecord_t;
00208

00214 /*
00215 ** Internal function start applications based on the startup script
00216 */
00217 void  CFE_ES_StartApplications(uint32 ResetType, uint8 *StartFilePath );
00218 
00219 /*
00220 ** Internal function to parse/execute a line of the cFE application startup 'script'
00221 */
00222 int32 CFE_ES_ParseFileEntry(char *FileEntry);
00223 
00224 /*
00225  * Internal function to synchronize application startup
00226  */
00227 int32 CFE_ES_ApplicationSyncDelay(uint32 MinimumSystemState, uint32 TimeOutMilliseconds);
00228 
00229 /*
00230 ** Internal function to create/start a new cFE app
00231 ** based on the parameters passed in
00232 */
00233 int32 CFE_ES_AppCreate(uint32 *ApplicationIdPtr,
00234                        char   *FileName,
00235                        char   *EntryPoint,
00236                        char   *AppName,
00237                        uint32  Priority,
00238                        uint32  StackSize,
00239                        uint32  ExceptionAction);
00240 /*
00241 ** Internal function to load a a new cFE shared Library
00242 */
00243 int32 CFE_ES_LoadLibrary(uint32 *LibraryIdPtr,
00244                        char   *Path,
00245                        char   *EntryPoint,
00246                        char   *Name);
00247 
00248 /*
00249 ** Get Application List
00250 */
00251 int32 CFE_ES_AppGetList(uint32 AppIdArray[], uint32 ArraySize);
00252 
00253 /*
00254 ** Dump All application properties to a file
00255 **  Note: Do we want to specify a file here?
00256 */
00257 int32 CFE_ES_AppDumpAllInfo(void);
00258 
00259 /*
00260 ** Scan the Application Table for actions to take
00261 */
00262 void CFE_ES_ScanAppTable(void);
00263 
00264 /*
00265 ** Perform the requested control action for an application
00266 */
00267 void CFE_ES_ProcessControlRequest(uint32 AppID);
00268 
00269 /*
00270 ** Clean up all app resources and delete it
00271 */
00272 int32 CFE_ES_CleanUpApp(uint32 AppId);
00273 
00274 /*
00275 ** Clean up all Task resources and detete the task
00276 */
00277 int32 CFE_ES_CleanupTaskResources(uint32 TaskId);
00278 
00279 /*
00280 ** Debug function to print out resource utilization 
00281 */
00282 int32 CFE_ES_ListResourcesDebug(void);
00283 
00284 /*
00285 ** Populate the cFE_ES_AppInfo structure with the data for an app
00286 ** This is an internal function for use in ES.
00287 ** The newer external API is : CFE_ES_GetAppInfo
00288 */
00289 void CFE_ES_GetAppInfoInternal(uint32 AppId, CFE_ES_AppInfo_t *AppInfoPtr );
